      • getStatements

        public info.aduna.iteration.CloseableIteration<? extends org.openrdf.model.Statement,org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException> getStatements(@Nullable
                                                                                                                                      org.openrdf.model.Resource subj,
                                                                                                                                      @Nullable
                                                                                                                                      org.openrdf.model.URI pred,
                                                                                                                                      @Nullable
                                                                                                                                      org.openrdf.model.Value obj,
                                                                                                                                      InferenceMode mode,
                                                                                                                                      org.openrdf.model.Resource... contexts)
                                                                                                                                        throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Delegates to wrapped transaction. One among four execution strategies is chosen, based on whether backward reasoning and/or filtering of closure statements must be performed:
        • delegation, in case no backward reasoning or filtering is required, or if just filtering is required but we know exactly the target contexts of the operation;
        • delegation with result filtering, in case filtering but not backward reasoning is required, target contexts are unspecified and BNode matching is involved;
        • query if either backward reasoning or filtering with unknown target contexts and no BNode matching is involved;
        • empty results if both backward reasoning and filtering are required, and no target context remains after excluding closure contexts.
        Specified by:
        getStatements in interface Transaction
        Overrides:
        getStatements in class ForwardingTransaction
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException

      • hasStatement

        public boolean hasStatement(@Nullable
                   org.openrdf.model.Resource subj,
                   @Nullable

                   @Nullable
                   org.openrdf.model.Value obj,
                   InferenceMode mode,
                   org.openrdf.model.Resource... contexts)
                     throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Delegates to wrapped transaction. Works similarly to getStatements(Resource, URI, Value, InferenceMode, Resource...), with the only exception that a boolean ASK query is issued instead of a SELECT tuple one.
        Specified by:
        hasStatement in interface Transaction
        Overrides:

      • composeQuery

        private static String composeQuery(Class<?> resultType,
                  @Nullable
                  org.openrdf.model.Resource subj,
                  @Nullable
                  org.openrdf.model.URI pred,
                  @Nullable
                  org.openrdf.model.Value obj,
                  org.openrdf.model.Resource[] contexts,
                  boolean distinct)
        Returns a SPARQL query string that matches statements having the supplied subject, predicate, object and contexts (wildcard allowed) and returns one among three possible results. Parameter resultType controls the result returned by the query, which can be the List of matched statements, a Long consisting in the number of matched statements or a Boolean that is true if at least a statement was matched. Note that none of the components must be a BNode, as it is not possible to match statements with BNodes with a SPARQL query.
        Parameters:
        resultType - the expected result of the query to compose; acceptable values are the class objects for List, Long and Boolean.
        subj - the subject to match, not a BNode and null if wildcard
        pred - the predicate to match, null if wildcard
        obj - the object to match, not a BNode and null if wildcard
        contexts - the contexts to match, not BNodes; empty array matches any context
        distinct - whether the query must return distinct quadruples
        Returns:
        the composed query string

      • remove

        public void remove(Iterable<? extends org.openrdf.model.Statement> statements,
          org.openrdf.model.Resource... contexts)
            throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Delegates to wrapped transaction. Delegates to the underlying transaction, notifies the inference session and updates the closure status. Note that on failure, the inference session is notified of a generic statements removal (null statements argument) as we don't know which and how many statements were deleted (we expect this situation to be likely handled with a rollback).
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Transaction
        Overrides:
        remove in class ForwardingTransaction
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException

      • end

        public void end(boolean commit)
         throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Delegates to wrapped transaction. Notifies a previously allocated InferencerSession (if any) of the closing transaction. This gives it the possibility to finalize a previously materialized closure (e.g., removing auxiliary statements), or to write auxiliary data used in the forward / backward inference process.
        Specified by:
        end in interface Transaction
        Overrides:
        end in class ForwardingTransaction
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
